intro: Androsace stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, opposite, ovate leaves that are typically covered in a fine layer of white or grayish hairs. Its flowers are usually white or pink, clustered in dense inflorescences, and bloom in early summer. Androsace stenophylla is adapted to harsh, rocky environments and is often found in mountainous areas with poor soil conditions.
